===Han character===
{{Han char|rn=74|rad=月|as=00|sn=4|four=77220|canj=B|ids=⿵冂二}}

# {{mul-kangxi radical-def}}

====Usage notes====
Do not confuse {{lang|mul|月}} with {{m|mul|⺼|sc=Hani}}, a form of {{m|mul|肉||flesh, meat}} when used as the left-hand radical of a character. {{m|mul|⺼|sc=Hani}} is used for parts of the body such as {{m|mul|背||back}} or {{m|mul|肝||liver}}. These may be written identically as {{lang|mul|月}}, but in careful use they are distinguished, with the inside of {{lang|mul|⺼|sc=Hani}} being written with unattached diagonal strokes. This is particularly an issue in looking up characters by radical; compare the [[Index:Chinese radical/月|月 index]] and [[Index:Chinese radical/肉|肉 index]].

==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} – pictographic representation of a [[crescent moon]].

===Etymology===
{{unk.|lang=zh}}. {{zh-ref|Unger (1992)}} proposes as cognate {{cog|bo|ངོ||waxing and waning moon; half moon}} (e.g. {{m|bo|མར་ངོ||waning moon}} and {{m|bo|ཡར་ངོ||waxing moon}}). Also compare {{cog|sit-pro|*s-ŋow||white; light colour}}.

{{zh-ref|Matisoff}} sets up {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-ŋʷ(j)a-t||moon; star}} for this, whence also {{w|Magar}} ''gya hot'' (“moon”).

{{cog|th|งวด||occasion; time; period}} may be a Chinese loan ({{zh-ref|Manomaivibool, 1975}}).

====Usage notes====
When used in compounds counting a number of months with "ヶ"([[か]], ''ka''), 月 is pronounced as [[げつ]] (''getsu''). When used in compounds for modern months of the year, it is pronounced as [[がつ]] (''gatsu''). When used for poetic or lunar months, it is pronounced as [[つき]] (''tsuki'').
